properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 2:58PM EST until January 13 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Southern Greenwood County in Upstate South Carolina...

* Until 900 PM EST Monday.

* At 255 PM EST, Greenwood County Emergency Management indicates
numerous roads were flooded as a result of heavy rainfall early
this morning and several roads remain flooded, primarily across
the southern third of the county, generally south of SC 34 and
Ninety-Six.  Storm-total rainfall amounts of 2-4 inches occurred
across most of Greenwood County, with an area of 3-4.5 inches
observed generally along a line from Bradley to Ninety-Six.

* Several roads remain closed, including:
Hunter Rd at County Line Rd;
Bethel Rd near Jordan Rd;
Dendy Bridge Rd near Indian Rd;
Warner Rd at Old Hastings Rd;
Tillman Territory Rd at Kinard Rd;
Paysinger Rd at Hwy 248;
McKenzie Rd;
and Tedards Store Rd;

* Please obey all barricades, even where water isn't covering the
roadway.  Roads and bridges must be inspected by engineers
following flooding to ensure they were not compromised and
barricades are in place for your safety.

* Only light showers are expected through this afternoon and early
evening; however, since several roads will remain flooded for several
more hours, a Flood Advisory has replaced the Flood Warning and
will remain in effect through this evening.

* Additional rounds of rainfall are expected tonight through early
tomorrow morning which may exacerbate residual flooding or cause
new flooding to develop. People in the Greenwood County area are
advised to stay weather aware.

* Some locations that will experience flood impacts include...
Ninety Six, Troy, Lake Greenwood State Park, Greenwood State Park,
Ninety Six Historic Site, Promised Land, Bradley, Kirksey, Dyson
and Callison.
properties.instruction:
Numerous roads, parking lots and bridges were impacted by flooding.
Please pay close attention to road signs indicating a flood-prone
area. Obey all barricades, even if water is not currently over the
road. Barricades are in place for your protection and indicate areas
where flooding can occur rapidly and without warning.
